titleInfo.title: Banquet for Auxiliaries and Board Members of the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society

physicalDescription.extent: 1 item (photograph), 8 x 10 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: Handwritten on envelope: ''#478 JCRS Auxiliary''. On back of photograph: ''standing, Noah W Allen, J.A. Sharoff, seated Israel Friedman, seated Ben Friedland, Mr and Mrs Ben Perlmutter, Mrs Israel Friedman, Mr and Mrs Dave Abramson, in main dining room at JCRS #478 JCRS Auxiliary and Board Members.''

mods.abstract: A dinner banquet for auxiliaries and board members of the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (JCRS) that was held in the main dining room at the JCRS. Pictured are Noah W. Allen, J.A. Sharoff, Israel Friedman, Ben Friedland, Mr. and Mrs. Ben Perlmutter, Mrs. Israel Friedman, Mr. and Mrs. Dave Abramson. The JCRS was a sanatorium for tuberculosis patients that was founded in 1904 by a group of immigrant Jewish workingmen along with the support of several leading physicians and rabbis in Denver, Colorado. The sanatorium was located on West Colfax Avenue just outside of Denver.
mods.note: Accession # 1271, Donated by AMC Cancer Research Center as part of the JCRS Records.
